title: M.S., Cancer Biology
description_1: Bernice Goldblatt Scholar, Cancer Research Foundation
description_2: Honored Graduate Student, University of Chicago Women's Board

title: B.A., Biological Sciences, Chemistry
description_1: General Honors; Specialization in Endocrinology; Dean's List 4 years

title: Pathology Research Technician
description_1: Developed and analyzed custom mouse models of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) in the Wu laboratory.
description_2: Produced high-titer CRISPR-Cas9 lentivirus. Purified and transduced HSCs for transplant into immunodeficient mice.
description_3: Developed and executed flow cytometry protocols to classify B cell lineages, track CLL progression, enrich for HSCs, and distinguish donor and recipient cells va the CD45 system.

title: Research Technician
description_1: Studied zebrafish development to investigate the homology between fish fins and tetrapod digits in the Shubin lab.
description_2: Performed summer and weekend (part-time) zebrafish husbandry and genotyping of CRISPR-generated Hoxa13a/Hoxa13b double mutant fish.

title: Graduate Research Assistant
description_1: Investigated the role of Blimp1 (PRDM1) in radiogenic stress response to analyze its role in protection from radiogenic breast cancer in the Onel/Cunningham lab.
description_2: Demonstrated that Blimp1 primary transcript, mRNA and protein expression increase after IR exposure; designed Blimp1 shRNAs and inducible overexpression vectors and transduced cell lines.
description_3: Performed proteomic analysis of cytarabine chemotherapy response in lymphoblastoid cells using microwestern arrays (MWAs) in the Jones lab.

title: Undergraduate Researcher
description_1: Studied the cellular uptake of VO(acac)2 to analyze its application as a contrast agent in PET scans in the Makinen lab. Demonstrated that VO(acac)2 enters the cell via the reduced folate carrier (RFC) protein using Western blots and RFC inhibitors.
description_2: Analyzed epigenetic differences in high-risk versus low-risk neuroblastoma cell lines and tumors with bisulfite sequencing in the Cohn lab.

title: Lead Content Developer, Data Science Professional Program
description_1: Maintain, revise and expand online content for the Data Science and Genomic Data Science MOOC series from HarvardX on edX, including dozens of new coding exercises.
description_2: Added a variety of new data sets and case studies to the course dslabs package for teaching data science in R, comprehensively edited the Introduction to Data Science textbook, and am co-authoring the solution guide.

title: Science Lab Coordinator
description_1: Prepared laboratory chemicals and materials, tested and improved protocols, and maintained laboratory equipment for 49 high school science teachers with 4000+ students.
description_2: Updated labs to incorporate modern scientific techniques, probeware, and inquiry-based principles into the high school curriculum.
description_3: Was a private and homebound student tutor for biology, chemistry, and anatomy and physiology.

title: Science REACH Co-sponsor and WYSE/TEAMS Sponsor
description_1: Helped ~80 students design, perform and present research projects for Illinois Junior Academy of Sciences and national science fairs.
description_2: Led ~70 students in training for STEM competitions.
description_3: Received the Ambassador Award for guiding students to top 5 state (WYSE) and top 10 national (TEAMS) performances.

title: Biology Student Teacher
description_1: Instructed ~140 grade 9 students in 3 sections of honors biology and 2 sections of general biology.
description_2: Promoted accessible student-centered learning with labs, activities and engaging technology for multiple learning styles.

title: Teaching Assistant
description_1: Assisted with numerous undergraduate and 1st year PhD graduate courses.
description_2: Prepared and taught weekly review sessions and exam preparation sessions, helped write exams, graded assignments and exams, fielded student questions, held office hours, and tutored students 1:1.
description_3: Courses: Endocrinology/Cell Signaling (4x), Biological Systems, Protein Fundamentals, and Cancer Biology Grant Writing
